CatDescriptText: Haywood Lyles, 1030 Third Street, Wierton, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think there would be less juvenile delinquency if the father were restored to his original role as sole head of the house?" answer reads: "I think that there would be less. If the man is at home, he will see that things are proper and the kids are home on time."
TitMainTitle: Haywood Lyles wearing houndstooth overcoat, dark suit jacket, light colored scarf, eyeglasses, and dark hat, standing across from Equitable Gas Company, and Raab clothing store, Wood Street at Liberty Avenue, Downtown
